trans-unit.source: Use this method in the Windows Store purchase API to grant a free app or in-app product (IAP) to a given user.
trans-unit.target: Use this method in the Windows Store purchase API to grant a free app or in-app product (IAP) to a given user.

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Use this method in the Windows Store purchase API to grant a free app or in-app product (IAP) to a given user.
trans-unit.target: Use this method in the Windows Store purchase API to grant a free app or in-app product (IAP) to a given user.

trans-unit.source: Currently, you can only grant free products.
trans-unit.target: Currently, you can only grant free products.

trans-unit.source: If your service attempts to use this method to grant a product that is not free, this method will return an error.
trans-unit.target: If your service attempts to use this method to grant a product that is not free, this method will return an error.

trans-unit.source: To use this method, you will need:
trans-unit.target: To use this method, you will need:

trans-unit.source: An Azure AD access token that was created with the **https://onestore.microsoft.com** audience URI.
trans-unit.target: An Azure AD access token that was created with the **https://onestore.microsoft.com** audience URI.

trans-unit.source: A Windows Store ID key that was generated by calling the [**GetCustomerPurchaseIdAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt608675) method from client-side code in your app.
trans-unit.target: A Windows Store ID key that was generated by calling the [**GetCustomerPurchaseIdAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt608675) method from client-side code in your app.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [View and grant products from a service](view-and-grant-products-from-a-service.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [View and grant products from a service](view-and-grant-products-from-a-service.md).

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD access token in the form **Bearer** <*token*>.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD access token in the form **Bearer** <*token*>.

trans-unit.source: Must be set to the value **collections.mp.microsoft.com**.
trans-unit.target: Must be set to the value **collections.mp.microsoft.com**.

trans-unit.source: The length of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The length of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the request and response type.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the request and response type.

trans-unit.source: Currently, the only supported value is **application/json**.
trans-unit.target: Currently, the only supported value is **application/json**.

trans-unit.source: The availability ID of the product to be purchased from the Windows Store catalog.
trans-unit.target: The availability ID of the product to be purchased from the Windows Store catalog.

trans-unit.source: The Windows Store ID key that represents the customer identity.
trans-unit.target: The Windows Store ID key that represents the customer identity.

trans-unit.source: A developer-specified offer ID that will appear in the Collection item after purchase.
trans-unit.target: A developer-specified offer ID that will appear in the Collection item after purchase.

trans-unit.source: A GUID generated for the order.
trans-unit.target: A GUID generated for the order.

trans-unit.source: This value be unique for the user, but it is not required to be unique across all orders.
trans-unit.target: This value be unique for the user, but it is not required to be unique across all orders.

trans-unit.source: The product ID from the Windows Store catalog.
trans-unit.target: The product ID from the Windows Store catalog.

trans-unit.source: To obtain your product ID, navigate to your app in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, go to the **App management** > **App identity** page, and retrieve the suffix of the string shown in the **URL for Windows 10** field.
trans-unit.target: To obtain your product ID, navigate to your app in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, go to the **App management** > **App identity** page, and retrieve the suffix of the string shown in the **URL for Windows 10** field.

trans-unit.source: Currently, the only supported value is 1.
trans-unit.target: Currently, the only supported value is 1.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, the default is 1.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, the default is 1.

trans-unit.source: The SKU ID from the Windows Store catalog.
trans-unit.target: The SKU ID from the Windows Store catalog.

trans-unit.source: Client contextual information for this order.
trans-unit.target: Client contextual information for this order.

trans-unit.source: This will be assigned to the *clientID* value from the Azure AD token.
trans-unit.target: This will be assigned to the *clientID* value from the Azure AD token.

trans-unit.source: The time the order was created.
trans-unit.target: The time the order was created.

trans-unit.source: The friendly name for the order.
trans-unit.target: The friendly name for the order.

trans-unit.source: N/A for orders made using the Windows Store purchase API.
trans-unit.target: N/A for orders made using the Windows Store purchase API.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether a payment instrument (PI) is required as part of the purchase order.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether a payment instrument (PI) is required as part of the purchase order.

trans-unit.source: The language ID for the order (for example, “en”).
trans-unit.target: The language ID for the order (for example, “en”).

trans-unit.source: The market ID for the order (for example, “US”).
trans-unit.target: The market ID for the order (for example, “US”).

trans-unit.source: An ID that identifies the order for a particular user.
trans-unit.target: An ID that identifies the order for a particular user.

trans-unit.source: The list of line items for the order.
trans-unit.target: The list of line items for the order.

trans-unit.source: Typically there is 1 line item per order.
trans-unit.target: Typically there is 1 line item per order.

trans-unit.source: The last time the order pricing is valid before it is submitted.
trans-unit.target: The last time the order pricing is valid before it is submitted.

trans-unit.source: The first time the order pricing is valid before it is submitted.
trans-unit.target: The first time the order pricing is valid before it is submitted.

trans-unit.source: An object that describes the identity of the purchaser.
trans-unit.target: An object that describes the identity of the purchaser.

trans-unit.source: The total purchase amount of all items in the order including tax.
trans-unit.target: The total purchase amount of all items in the order including tax.

trans-unit.source: Total purchase amount of all items in the order before tax.
trans-unit.target: Total purchase amount of all items in the order before tax.

trans-unit.source: If using a separate payment instrument and stored value (CSV), the amount charged to CSV.
trans-unit.target: If using a separate payment instrument and stored value (CSV), the amount charged to CSV.

trans-unit.source: The total amount of tax for all line items.
trans-unit.target: The total amount of tax for all line items.

trans-unit.source: The ClientContext object contains the following parameters.
trans-unit.target: The ClientContext object contains the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: The client ID that created the order.
trans-unit.target: The client ID that created the order.

trans-unit.source: The OrderLineItemV6 object contains the following parameters.
trans-unit.target: The OrderLineItemV6 object contains the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: The agent that last edited the line item.
trans-unit.target: The agent that last edited the line item.

trans-unit.source: For more information about this object, see the table below.
trans-unit.target: For more information about this object, see the table below.

trans-unit.source: The availability ID of the product to be purchased from the Windows Store catalog.
trans-unit.target: The availability ID of the product to be purchased from the Windows Store catalog.

trans-unit.source: The identity of the beneficiary of the order.
trans-unit.target: The identity of the beneficiary of the order.

trans-unit.source: The billing state of the order.
trans-unit.target: The billing state of the order.

trans-unit.source: This is set to **Charged** when completed.
trans-unit.target: This is set to **Charged** when completed.

trans-unit.source: The campaign ID for this order.
trans-unit.target: The campaign ID for this order.

trans-unit.source: The currency code used for price details.
trans-unit.target: The currency code used for price details.

trans-unit.source: A localized description of the line item.
trans-unit.target: A localized description of the line item.

trans-unit.source: The offer ID for the particular order, if present.
trans-unit.target: The offer ID for the particular order, if present.

trans-unit.source: The state of the fulfillment of this item.
trans-unit.target: The state of the fulfillment of this item.

trans-unit.source: This is set to **Fulfilled** when completed.
trans-unit.target: This is set to **Fulfilled** when completed.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether a payment instrument is required for this line item.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether a payment instrument is required for this line item.

trans-unit.source: Indicated whether tax is included in the pricing details of the item.
trans-unit.target: Indicated whether tax is included in the pricing details of the item.

trans-unit.source: The line item ID for the item in this order.
trans-unit.target: The line item ID for the item in this order.

trans-unit.source: The list price of the item in this order.
trans-unit.target: The list price of the item in this order.

trans-unit.source: The Windows Store product ID of the line item.
trans-unit.target: The Windows Store product ID of the line item.

trans-unit.source: The quantity of the item ordered.
trans-unit.target: The quantity of the item ordered.

trans-unit.source: The retail price of the item ordered.
trans-unit.target: The retail price of the item ordered.

trans-unit.source: The Windows Store SKU ID of the line item.
trans-unit.target: The Windows Store SKU ID of the line item.

trans-unit.source: The tax amount for the line item.
trans-unit.target: The tax amount for the line item.

trans-unit.source: The tax type for the applicable taxes.
trans-unit.target: The tax type for the applicable taxes.

trans-unit.source: The localized title of the line item.
trans-unit.target: The localized title of the line item.

trans-unit.source: The total purchase amount of the line item including tax.
trans-unit.target: The total purchase amount of the line item including tax.

trans-unit.source: The IdentityV6 object contains the following parameters.
trans-unit.target: The IdentityV6 object contains the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: The string value of the *publisherUserId* from the specified Windows Store ID key.
trans-unit.target: The string value of the *publisherUserId* from the specified Windows Store ID key.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD access token is invalid.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD access token is invalid.

trans-unit.source: In some cases the details of the ServiceError will contain more information, such as when the token is expired or the *appid* claim is missing.
trans-unit.target: In some cases the details of the ServiceError will contain more information, such as when the token is expired or the *appid* claim is missing.

trans-unit.source: An Azure AD access token was not passed to the service in the authorization header.
trans-unit.target: An Azure AD access token was not passed to the service in the authorization header.

trans-unit.source: The *clientId* claim in the Windows Store ID key in the request body and the *appid* claim in the Azure AD access token in the authorization header do not match.
trans-unit.target: The *clientId* claim in the Windows Store ID key in the request body and the *appid* claim in the Azure AD access token in the authorization header do not match.

trans-unit.source: The details contain information regarding the request body and which fields have an invalid value.
trans-unit.target: The details contain information regarding the request body and which fields have an invalid value.

trans-unit.source: View and grant products from a service
trans-unit.target: View and grant products from a service

trans-unit.source: Renew a Windows Store ID key
trans-unit.target: Renew a Windows Store ID key
